definitions.definition: A daughter of the same parents as another person; a female sibling.
definitions.example: My sister is always driving me crazy.

definitions.definition: A female member of a religious order; especially one devoted to more active service; (informally) a nun.
definitions.example: Michelle left behind her bank job and became a sister at the local convent.

definitions.definition: Any butterfly in the genus Adelpha, so named for the resemblance of the dark-colored wings to the black habit traditionally worn by nuns.
A senior or supervisory nurse, often in a hospital.
Any woman or girl with whom a bond is felt through common membership of a race, profession, religion or organization, such as feminism.
definitions.example: Connie was very close to her friend Judy and considered her to be her sister.

definitions.definition: A form of address to a woman.
A woman, in certain labour or socialist circles; also as a form of address.
definitions.example: Thank you, sister. I would like to thank the sister who just spoke.

definitions.definition: An entity that has a special or affectionate, non-hierarchical relationship with another.
A node in a data structure that shares its parent with another node.
(usually attributively) Something in the same class.
To strengthen (a supporting beam) by fastening a second beam alongside it.
definitions.example: I’m trying to correct my sagging floor by sistering the joists.

definitions.definition: To be sister to; to resemble closely.
